sub_title: Marketing | Strategy | Digital | Innovation | Branding | Data Driven | Change Management
summary:
As an experienced B2B and B2C marketing professional, I have worked on a global, national and regional level for various companies in different industries. I am experienced in (digital) marketing, strategy, innovation, branding, analysis of (customer) data and use these insights to improve marketing and product performance. I am able to work under pressure and handle various strategic (digital) marketing projects. Working with colleagues from different levels in the organization is what I like, as well as maintaining contact with important stakeholders and guide agencies. I strive for the best results and enjoy working with people with a different professional and/or cultural background. 

Expertise
✰ Strategy / Marketing / Market research
✰ Innovation / New Product Development 
✰ Digital Marketing / Social Media
✰ Brand management & development 
✰ Database marketing / CRM
✰ Personas and Customer Journeys 
✰ Improve online Customer Experience 
✰ Marketing Communications (ATL/BTL) / Digital campaigns focused on conversion 
✰ Data & Customer insights analysis and reporting
✰ Change Management & Storytelling
✰ Agency management

school.name: Rotterdam School of Management, Erasmus University

education.field_of_study: High School, Louise de Coligny S.G. in Leiden

projects.title: Campaign Positioning Wealth Management Rabobank
projects.description: The region Rabobank Westland operates in is known for its large group of entrepreneurs - where businesses are usually handed over from father to son - who want to get financial advice on the best way to invest and secure their money for their future plans. This is done in an unique and personal way by the account managers from Private Banking Rabobank Westland, where specialists are called in to guarantee the best solution for their customers. Part of the positioning campaign was to create a short and appealing film shared through social media.

contributors.headline: Marketing | Strategy | Digital | Innovation | Branding | Data Driven | Change Management
Senior adviseur Marketing & Communicatie | strategie | woordvoering | in- en externe communicatie | social media | creatieve concepten | overtuigende content

projects.title: 'Voice of the customer'​ panels (klantarena's) Rabobank
projects.description: With the theme ‘Klantbelang centraal’ I set-up a total of 11 VOC panels all commercial departments (B2B and B2C), from May 2013 until November 2014. We received and talked to almost 100 customers, who openly talked about their experiences regarding the financial services received from the Rabobank: the successes, but also the disappointments. Our customers appreciated the fact that employers from the Rabobank took time to listen to them and showed its willingness to improve the financial service. Every customer panel ended summarizing improvements colleagues should take up in their service towards customers, most of them even the very next day. These customer panels were an example for other local Rabobank and experiences and examples were shared with them.

contributors.headline: Marketing | Strategy | Digital | Innovation | Branding | Data Driven | Change Management
Senior adviseur Marketing & Communicatie | strategie | woordvoering | in- en externe communicatie | social media | creatieve concepten | overtuigende content

projects.title: Recognize the house: Online campaign for the local residential market of Rabobank Westland
projects.description: In 2011 the residential market was very slow and Rabobank Westland was not the obvious partner anymore to get a mortgage from. Together with the agency BrandWebbing an image and branding campaign for the residential market was developed. Through 2 interactive online advertisements on the sites: ‘Nu.nl, Marktplaats.nl and Funda’ - all visible on postal codes – 2 known houses in Maassluis and Naaldwijk where shown and could be ‘built’ online by potential customers. Also flyers and ads in local newspapers where produced to draw attention to this campaign. It became a huge success, appealed to and attracted a whole new audience and was the very first online campaign for Rabobank Westland.

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for all marketing activities and the NPD's for the Legal market. First point of contact regarding set up of market research, conduct market analyses, set up and tweak (digital) campaigns and events. 
Propose and lead product innovation, test and launch propositions in the market (from idea to market).

Primary activities:
◆ advise Stakeholders (Management, Content, Innovation, Product Management, Sales) regarding the marketing strategy for the Legal market
◆ write the annual marketing plan based on customer insights, market trends and technology 
◆ participate in the MT Legal for Marketing 
◆ control of marketing budget and forecast
◆ set up of new (digital) campaigns with digital campaign marketers, Retail, E-commerce via Scrum
◆ interact with clients, developers, UX designers, Sales, Content, agencies to set up and test online proposition ideas & introduce to target groups
◆ develop product innovations (through: lean startup, design thinking), conduct pilots in the market, plan market introductions and responsible for internal promotion of new products
◆ look at developments, such as Artificial Intelligence and the use for our customers
◆ coach a team of digital campaign marketers, SEO & SEA specialists, analysts, market researcher and Event Manager
◆ setting up dashboards: (online) marketing and financial kpi's 
◆ participate in several projects such as:
- marketing automation (Eloqua): pass on knowledge, coordinate, set-up and roll-out digital (inbound & outbound) campaigns, lead scoring, lead nurturing, MQL/SQL, set up reporting   
- persona development, set up buyer journey, content mapping/creation and optimize personas
- lean: improvement of marketing campaign process
- Innovation / Lean startup: work in multi disciplinary team, Google Design Sprint, agile way of working, test hypotheses, develop MVP's
profile_positions.title: Sr. Segment Marketing Manager

profile_positions.description:
Working for a local/regional bank focusing on the Consumer and Private Banking market. Customers in the age of 0 up to 100, aimed at a.o. savings, mortgages, wealth management. Development and launch of online services and products. First point of contact for the M&C team and sparring partner for the managing directors and managers. 

Primary activities: 
◆ write the annual marketing strategy plans for various target groups 
◆ execute strategy through online and offline (positioning, branding) campaigns and events 
◆ develop and launch (digital) financial products and services in the Consumer market
◆ develop personas, customer journeys including touchpoints and content mapping  
◆ digital marketing responsibilities, such as:
- determine the B2B/B2C digital marketing strategy plan (3 years goals) and execute  
- SEO/SEA, content creation and mapping, optimize website
- set up digital campaigns through, e.g.: Facebook/Twitter/LinkedIn/YouTube/Email/Mobile
- A/B testing to improve campaigns
- webcare, social listening, influencers
- develop an app for the housing market via Agile/Scrum
◆ conduct various types of market research, such as:
- online research, focus groups, polls
- VOC/'Klantbelang Centraal' panels, co-creation sessions with customers 
◆ database marketing: 
- quality of data and analysis (customer profile and behavior, segments, use of channel etc.) 
- set up a database to determine potential private banking customers in the region
◆ chairman of strategic B2C/B2B projects, such as:
- lead the digital transformation 
- determine the B2B/B2C digital marketing strategy plan (3 years goals) and execute  
- introduce the Net Promoter Score (NPS) and set up customers’ feedback 
- improve the omnichannel experience for customers
- improve the online user experience for customers to increase traffic, leads and conversion    
◆ lead a team of marketing, communication, CRM and data specialists
◆ take over responsibilities of manager M&C
profile_positions.title: Marketing Manager

profile_positions.description:
Unilever Food Solutions (UFS) is the B2B division of Unilever, selling to chefs in 75 countries. Focus for 2016 was on the transformation of the company in order to reach more chefs through digital marketing (traffic, content, data, E-commerce). Driven by the 22 digital conversion leaders globally and in line with the strategy as set up by the Global Digital Marketing HQ in Rotterdam. 

Primary activities:
◆ collect insights from digital leaders globally regarding their digital skills and their needs 
◆ analyze the results from the digital capabilities survey sent to all digital leaders worldwide
◆ advise on and develop the 'Digital Conversion Leader Program 2016' in line with the 2017 targets and focus on conversion towards chefs
profile_positions.title: Project Global Digital Marketing

profile_positions.description:
Specialized in the rental and sale of audiovisual equipment for the business market, such as shareholders' meetings, television productions, events and fairs.

Primary activities:
◆ set up the marketing department 
◆ advise General Managers on the marketing strategy, write/execute the annual marketing plan 
◆ participate in MT & involve other members in the strategy and execution
◆ develop audiovisual propositions together with Innovation, Sales, technicians and IT
◆ introduce audiovisual propositions and products to reach a wider audience in various industries
◆ conduct market research, competitor  and price analyses
◆ work with global manufacturing companies for the introduction of new products/propositions
◆ set up of CRM and provide customers with tailor made information (cross-sell/up-sell)
◆ Email marketing (provide selected information at various target groups)
◆ develop branding and communication materials, such as:
- new website (content/linkbuilding), webshop, optimize website to improve online UX
- company brochures and corporate movie
- content creation for the quarterly magazine with testimonials/product information
- advertisements and set up of media planning
◆ lead a team of product managers, communication assistant and trainees
◆ maintain close contact with advertising agencies and the press
profile_positions.title: Sr. Marketer

profile_positions.description:
When working for Telfort it became part of O2, a mobile provider in the UK. This meant regular contact with the managers from the HQ in London in my job as a proposition manager.

Primary activities:
◆ conduct market and consumer needs research, use insights for a new mobile subscription
◆ develop and launch the new business mobile subscription for the SME market 
◆ lead the sr. technical product manager and project manager for technical details & SLA's
◆ set up of customer requirements for Customer Service and the Dealer channel
◆ maintain close contact with Legal to set up the contracts for the Dealer channel
◆ set up/present business cases for the board of directors (launch subscription & campaigns)
◆ develop (in-store) branding communication material such as: radio commercials, billboards, packaging material, press releases, roll-out new website and responsible for content delivery
◆ participate in several projects such as:
- set up of CRM  
- Supply Chain Management 
- Xda device: the first edition of an integrated pocket pc with GSM and GPRS functionality
- migration and retention of customers
◆ manage the product portfolio of handhelds throughout the product life cycle
◆ maintain close contact with the advertising agency and the press
profile_positions.title: Proposition Manager Mobile Voice

profile_positions.description:
Japanese company specialized in digital copiers, printers and cameras with its HQ for Europe, Middle East and Africa located in the Netherlands. Customers ranged from architects and fashion designers to multinationals.

Primary activities:
◆ introduce the first digital copiers worldwide, lead the product roadmap and positioning for EMEA
◆ responsible for international market research, consumer insights and competitive analyses
◆ translate these data/insights into new product concepts or features for the EMEA market
◆ perform test marketing at customers’ sites, discuss results with R&D Japan for improvement 
◆ drive innovation and new product development (NPD) 
◆ provide local marketing support to stakeholders from Marketing and Sales for product launches
◆ interact with colleagues from IT/technology, Supply Chain and Translation 
◆ create various branding communication material, such as: brochures, photography, videos  
◆ provide product knowledge to Sales/Area Managers when abroad during trainings and fairs
profile_positions.title: Sr. Product Specialist EMEA
